definitions: To apply force to something, typically with one's hand or a tool, in order to move it, flatten it, or compress it.
To urge or push someone to do something.
To make something flat or smooth by applying pressure or heat.
To extract juice or liquid from something by squeezing or crushing it.
To crowd or gather around something or someone.
examples: Press the button to start the machine.
She pressed him for an answer.
Press your shirt to remove wrinkles.
They press grapes to make wine.
The crowd began to press forward.
